messages.content:
Hello everyone,

I just got a rather cryptic failure during a  proving step in a ZKProgram:

```
    Constraint unsatisfied (unreduced):
    field_inverse
    Checked.inv
    assert_non_zero: File "src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/utils.ml", line 174, characters 2-106
    any: File "src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/utils.ml", line 392, characters 6-97
    File "src/mina/src/lib/pickles/wrap_main.ml", line 261, characters 21-28
    File "src/mina/src/lib/pickles/wrap_main.ml", line 160, characters 15-22

    Constraint:
    ((basic(R1CS(Add(Var 26730)(Add(Constant 1)(Scale 28948022309329048855892746252171976963363056481941647379679742748393362948096(Var 131))))(Var 26732)(Constant 1)))(annotation(field_inverse)))
    Data:
    R1CS 0 0 1
```

I am debugging what exactly the issue is, but perhaps someone knows what exactly could be causing this.

Rest of stack trace in the comment below:

```
at failwith (ocaml/ocaml/stdlib.ml:29:14)
      at ../../../../../home/gregor/.opam/4.14.0/lib/base/printf.ml:6:43
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/checked_runner.ml:216:13
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/checked_runner.ml:54:30
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/checked_runner.ml:65:20
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/checked_runner.ml:168:21
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/checked_runner.ml:54:30
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/checked_runner.ml:168:21
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/checked_runner.ml:168:21
      at any$1 (src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:878:25)
      at _iMR_ (src/mina/src/lib/pickles/wrap_main.ml:337:30)
      at mapn (src/mina/src/lib/pickles_types/vector.ml:97:15)
      at mapn (src/mina/src/lib/pickles_types/vector.ml:98:16)
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/pickles/wrap_main.ml:289:17
      at with_label (src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:1253:15)
      at with_label (src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:1253:15)
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/pickles/wrap.ml:887:59
      at handle (src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:1237:15)
      at _iy__ (src/mina/src/lib/pickles/wrap.ml:887:13)
      at mark_active (src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:1167:19)
      at _pi4_ (src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:1302:52)
      at as_stateful (src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:755:15)
      at 
```

````
../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/runners.ml:82:22
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/runners.ml:305:34
      at ../../../../../workspace_root/src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:1302:19
      at finalize_is_running (src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:1272:15)
      at generate_witness_conv (src/mina/src/lib/snarky/src/base/snark0.ml:1301:7)
      at withThreadPool (o1js/src/bindings/js/node/node-backend.js:55:14)
      at prettifyStacktracePromise (o1js/src/lib/errors.ts:137:12)
      at prove_ (o1js/src/lib/proof_system.ts:394:18)
```
By "cryptic" i mean that the point in circuit where the failure has occurred is not clear.

` at ../../../../../home/gregor/.opam/4.14.0/lib/base/printf.ml:6:43`

@gregor FYI 😄: `/home/gregor/.opam/`
What version of o1js do you use?
it appears to have an issue here?

There is a similar issue on github, not sure that it has the same root cause:
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1236
Thanks @DFST ! It does seem related, however, in my case it's not happening at the smart contact level, but rather directly on ZKProgram.
I believe it's somewhere in "serializing the return of the method". I added more log statements, up to the last possible return, and it looks like the method never returns 🤨
I'm playing around and seeing if cache could be at fault. If anyone has any insights, I'd be extremely thankful, because this is a major blocker 🙌
I tried a full recompile and the same issue is still hapening :/

Can you simplify it by removing all the code except this one (you can put constants as values) and putting it directly in the method, and then, if it works, add  back original code line by line? It will create a minimum code for github issue or will resolve the problem

To me the stack trace looks like the failing constraint doesn't occur in your circuit, but in the pickles wrap circuit (wrap_main) which recursively wraps the proof.

It could still be caused by some malformedness of your circuit, or most likely of the recursive proofs your using
@DFST thanks, I will try a few options like you suggested

@gregor thank you. Do you happen to have examples of what exactly could be malformed in the recursive proofs? Any hint is useful.

There are a total of 3 distinct circuits being used here (thus 2 different recursive proofs): Circuit1 ---> Circuit2 ---> Circuit3. I have tried passing Circuit1-->Circuit2 to Circuit4 (a different circuit), and everything worked as expected. If I pass a different circuit proof to Circuit3 it also succeeds. So the problem appears to be happening in the Circuit1-->Circuit2--->Circuit3.
No don't have anything - the error is new to me

Thanks. I'll continue looking it. Trying different approaches now.

Could it be possible that this is caused by the garbage collection? For example, let's say I compile a proof, and don't keep a hot referrence to it.
So..... I hammered the fix in. By removing methods from a ZkProgram that **were not being used** in the proof generation 🤨
Original
"Fixed"
Now... I actually did want to move those two methods out of the ZkProgram, as an optimization, but why did this error even occur? 🤔
I guess for now we have **Zero Knowledge** on that topic 🕶 We can call it a feature! 😄
Also, `GeoPointInPolygonCircuit2` works correctly with self-recursive proofs, when other set of proofs are provided to them as a private input.
I got closer the to the core issue! The issue only happens when I set the arguments of the method as SelfProof. Below are the examples:
Both arguments in `helloWorld` are SelfProof: **ERROR**
Both arguments in `helloWorld` are Field: **NO ERROR**

A Field followed by SelfProof argument results in **NO ERROR**. It also works if you switch the positional of Field and SelfProof. 

It appears that this ZkProgram is racist towards itself, but only when two of its own kind are present.

Is there a limit to how many recursive proofs in total can be verified?

Imagine the following:

Circuit 1 produces a proof
Circuit 2 receives Circuit 1 proof as an argument
Circuit 3 receives Circuit 2 proof as an argument, and can receive Circuit 3 proofs (self proofs) as an argument

Is there anything faulty about such a design?

Hmmm... There was a similar bug in o1js, but it was fixed in o1js 0.15.1:
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1210

I would check how you deal with SelfProof arguments and would add verify() call before passing SelfProof to validate that SelfProof is valid
Can you also try to use publicInput instead of publicOutput? Two SelfProofs with publicInput work for sure, the only difference in your code that I see is that you use publicOutput
As an update, separating the recursive part into a separate circuit "fixed" the problem

@DFST thanks for the feedback. Please check the reply above. I'm moving forward for now, as I've spent a significant amonut of time debugging this 😅 I will have the original code history on GitHub, so can come back to it at any time. I've provided quite a lot of context here, so perhaps this would be enough to discern what the underlying issue is.
OH how beautiful it is to see this 🥹🥹
Maybe given that you have now small example with error,  it makes sense to put it as issue on o1js github so it can be investigated by o1js team
Yeah @illya thanks a lot for this investigation. Can you post your failing contract with the helloWorld method that has two `SelfProof`s on GH in an issue? This looks like an important bug to fix
No problem! @gregor I'll post it either a bit later today, or latest tomorrow (I'll design a nice looking issue with clear reproducible code).
